etymology.description: 大 (great) + 同 (together; unity) + 区/區 (district) = Datong District (Taipei)
etymology.interpretation: Proper name of a Taipei district; 大同 evokes the classical ideal of “Great Unity,” and 区/區 marks it as an administrative district. In context it refers specifically to Taipei’s Datong District.
etymology.simplification: 區 was simplified to 区 in Mainland Chinese to reduce strokes; Taiwan officially writes the district as 大同區.

examples.chinese: 我住在台北市大同区(我住在臺北市大同區)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Táiběi Shì Dàtóng Qū.
examples.english: I live in Datong District, Taipei.

examples.chinese: 大同区拥有迪化街等历史街区(大同區擁有迪化街等歷史街區)。
examples.pinyin: Dàtóng Qū yōngyǒu Díhuà Jiē děng lìshǐ jiēqū.
examples.english: Datong District has historic streets such as Dihua Street.

examples.chinese: 我们去大同区逛年货大街吧(我們去大同區逛年貨大街吧)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù Dàtóng Qū guàng niánhuò dàjiē ba.
examples.english: Let's go stroll the New Year goods street in Datong District.
